embeds.title: Copy Paste
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Play a copy of each Encoded card. They do not Encode.
â€‹~~- **Exhaust**. -~~

messages.content: just
finish the function
and play it
for 1 energy
I mean like
you could have like 2 null pointer, never finish the function, and spam this?
what is this card
Ctrl C Ctrl V
I like this card thematically, but in terms of its power... idk
also works TERRIBLY with minor beams
We already have the ability to play unfinished functions. It's called "Finishing the function". Redundant most of the time.
Requires a very specific, non-encode spam deck to work best.
I'm tempted to compare it to <reprogram> in the sense that it encourages you to build against your main class identity.

embeds.title: Reprogram
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Lose 1 (2) **Focus** :p_focus:.
Gain 1 (2) **Strength** :p_strength:.
Gain 1 (2) **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: But it also requires that you have those cards anyways?
Good synergy with [[Electromagnetic Coil]]

embeds.title: Electromagnetic Coil
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Automaton / Downfall

Functions are now made up of 4 cards.
*-# An inefficient but entertaining power source.*

messages.content: though that is more funny than good

Very strange card, in theory it could be worth it two get two effects for 1 energy, but they would need to be pretty strong ones (likely ones involving errors like null pointer), and even then it's very situational and unreliable. Coil lets you get one extra effect out, and runic pyramid lets you time this optimally, but otherwise it seems very hard to line up properly. As is often the case for automaton, you would probably be better off just playing more encode cards to spam efficient functions for value than rely on this. I could maybe see it being interesting if it was cheaper, or could upgrade to have retain. Upgrading to remove exhaust actually seems like mostly a negative, since timing this effectively a second time will be even harder, when there are less encode cards left in your deck since they've already been compiled. It's just too niche, unreliable, and weak right now to be worth taking often.
reprogram can be built around
you can't build around copy paste
Exactly
Nowhere near enough payout for what you need to sacrifice.
man, if only there was a way to get encode cards to activate their effects for a 2nd time
this is really a "wow why don't i just play another encode and then play the function" deal
also upgrade to not exhaust is very silly
no actually i want this garbage to exhaust if it's in my deck
it will always be worse than just playing the generated function
if it played the cards twice then that would be barely ok maybe bordering on OP for certain cards
the fact it doesnâ€™t even trigger compile effects is meh
but then you could just farm cultist strike
idk
seems like a card that just doesnâ€™t want to exist
I guess you could use it as a weird cantrip with <buggy mess> + <goto+>???????????

embeds.title: Buggy Mess
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 (0) :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

**Insert** a Dazed.
Gain 1 :energy_auto: .
**Encode.**

embeds.title: Goto
embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
**Encode.**
**Compile** - Next turn, draw 1 (2) card (cards).

messages.content: That could technically work if you are not using functions to scale
e.g. if you are using the status common or burnout as your big hit
<cycle wound>

embeds.title: Bug Barrage
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Gain 1 Wound.
**Cycle** each **Status**, dealing 7 (10) damage for each.

messages.content: yes but the thing is

unless you are using stuff with compile error, why would you ever bother not just playing a third encode and just ... playing the function every deck cycle instead of playing a copy paste every deck cycle
yes
we are giving contrived edge cases where it would be useful
but overall we can safely say it is not useful

Oh sick this card is great! It means you can play 2 cards for the cost of 1!!

wait a second *checks notes* oh you're telling me the character's whole mechanic is playing 3 cards for the cost of 1? And it's way less restrictive than this? And it doesn't exhaust?
Yeah this is a cool concept until you remember that this is just "*conditionally* play a worse function"
Overall this is just such a pointless card, surprised it didn't make the list for the worst card tournament.
Although I don't think it would make it too far, you're still playing 2 cards for the cost of 1. It's not a bad card, there's just way better options (the entire character mechanic)
It's like if defect had a card that removed an orb slot and gave 1 metallicize. It's just worse orbs.
Itâ€™s like if Ironclad had a skill that removed all Vulnerable from an enemy and dealt like 5 damage for each stack removed
I applied the Vulnerable for a reason, thanks 👍
hey did someone say minor beam
Iâ€™d rather have an uncommon or rare card that triggers any encode effects again
that would make Perfection stacking actually viable instead of relying on Bit Shift and Dev Tools
(and Dev Tools is already OP as we have established)
What do you define as an encode effect?
Constructor, Separator
"when encoded", basically
maybe it could be rare and upgrade to trigger compile effects too ? idk
<constructor>

embeds.title: Constructor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Gain 5 (7) **Block** :p_block:.   When Encoded as the first card, increase its **Block** :p_block: by 5 (7).
**Encode.**

messages.content: I just wanted to check the wording
if you create a function using constructor, separator (x2), and terminator, you get perfection
unfortunately it's just a meme
there are easier ways to win using dev tools
well the problem with perfection is that you actually need to use some modicum of effort to set it up, which kinda goes against a lot of practical wisdom of auto, which is play big functions a lot.
yeah and having a card that can just dump extra encodes without going thru that long process would be *perfection*
I think each piece individually is alright, I quite like constructor, as block is a nice thing to have in functions. Separator definitely the worst one of the bunch.
and terminator is alright, but knocked down by the fact that if you draw it and can't place it last it's just a dead draw.
terminator needs in-built retain.
No I think it's quite fine
this is the hill i am dying on today
It's a rather powerful effect.
and I think the card is finely balanced
This is as much a jab at perfection as it is a jab at auto's mechanics.
what if terminator doubled compile effects as an upgrade?
I think that's a cool concept actually, not sure if it needs it though.
(this includes compile errors(
I could see a relic idea based around doubling compile effects, whether it be a rare doing so once a turn (this is definitely too strong) or a common being the first per combat.
the first time you play a power each turn?
wait why throw in powers into the mix?
bronze has a few ways of making powers
It does???
because it makes it less strong than once per turn but still something you can theoretically get every turn
Mutator, the compile effect rare
those allow you to create powers
Ah I forgot about that one, the one you only take with bird faced urn or mummy hand
this would give you a third reason to take it
not as strong as the other two but still a consideration
At least that's the only time I would, it doesn't really have much merit on its own, so abusing the fact that it is an infinitely replayable power is the best way to go about it.
I still think that would feel really awkward, a relic that wants you to play a power to buff a non-power character specific mechanic with no ties to powers.
Sounds like a modded relic, mostly in the way of "it might be balanced, but it's so inconvenient to use that no one uses it anyway" like [[toy rocket]]

embeds.title: Toy Rocket
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Reliquary

The first time you play a cost 3, cost 2, and cost 1 card in a row each combat, add a powerful cost 0 Attack into your hand.
*-# We choose to go to the Spire.*

messages.content: If you aren't consciously thinking about this relic at all times it's a dead relic.
I never got it to activate, mostly because I stopped using reliquary rather quickly (just didn't feel like the relics fit in with the base game like other mods I've seen do)
but double upgrades are peak
the point is I donâ€™t want the idea to be wasted by making it once per combat; so are there any other conditions we can gate it behind so that it is not an OP rare?
exhaust a card during your turn?
that seems like a thing Bronzo can do semi-reliably
<cleanse>

embeds.title: Cleanse
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Deal 9 (12) damage.
**Exhaust** a random **Status** card in your draw pile.

messages.content: play a function? (so your first function can never have doubled compile effects? then spaghetti code becomes okay as a fodder for triggering the relic)
every time you reshuffle?
